thread.title: Penn State has the Lion statue; Michigan State has one of Magic - and Michigan fans get to it ahead of football game
thread.title_full: Penn State has the Lion statue; Michigan State has one of Magic - and Michigan fans get to it ahead of football game

title: Penn State has the Lion statue; Michigan State has one of Magic - and Michigan fans get to it ahead of football game
text:
Penn State has the Lion statue; Michigan State has one of Magic — and Michigan fans get to it ahead of football game Dale G. Young / AP A Michigan State fan stands watch over Sparty, an on-campus statuue that's the target of pranks during the week leading up to the game with Michigan. Wolverine supporters struck earlier this week, spraying yellow paint on another statue on campus of former Spartan basketball star Magie Johnson. A Michigan State fan stands watch over Sparty, an on-campus statuue that's the target of pranks during the week leading up to the game with Michigan. Wolverine supporters struck earlier this week, spraying yellow paint on another statue on campus of former Spartan basketball star Magie Johnson. (Dale G. Young / AP) Magic turned yellow at Michigan State 
EAST LANSING, Mich. (AP) — A statue of Earvin "Magic" Johnson on the campus of Michigan State University has been vandalized with yellow paint ahead of the Spartans' football game against rival Michigan. 
The statue of the former NBA and Michigan State basketball star is outside the Breslin Center in East Lansing. It had an "M" and the words "BEAT STATE" painted on it. Michigan's colors are maize and blue. 
MLive.com reports the statue was being cleaned Thursday and vandals also defaced the sidewalk along Demonstration Hall Road and an area behind the "Sparty" statue. 
No. 12 Michigan hosts No. 7 Michigan State on Saturday and supporters have been on guard duty to prevent possible vandalism to campus landmarks. In Ann Arbor, Michigan students are guarding the block "M" on the Diag.
